hanzi-su-wiki:
乗

Значения

Садиться (в транспорт); ехать; стоять, лежать на чем-либо; умножать

Мнемоника

Боевая колесница с возможностью обстрела противника сразу с двух сторон. Три нижние черты — постромки для трёх лошадей. Выше, спина к спине, сидят два стрелка. Верхняя черта — шатровый верх.

Варианты

乘, 椉

rtega_mnemonic:
乗乗RSride, ascend, avail oneself of, numerary adjunct for vehicles, power
  • modf. 乘 → 乗: two men climbing up a tree
heisig_story: The simplest way to remember this character is to find the sprig of wheat in it, hidden because it doubles up with one stroke of silage.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: ride, power, multiplication, record, counter for vehicles, board, mount, join
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: езды, мощность, умножение, запись, счетчик для транспортных средств, доска, крепление, присоединиться
koohiiStory1: It´s a hay ride! You sit on piles of silage and everyone likes to imitate old-time farmers with a piece of wheat sticking out of their mouths.
koohiiStory2: [ride; power; multiplication; record; counter for vehicles; board; mount; join] In the near future, we hope to ride on biomass fueled vehicles. Good news for those who have wheat silage surplus.
jp_example_words:
乗客(じょうかく): passenger
乗せる(のせる): to place on (something), to take on board, to give a ride, to let (one) take part, to impose on, to record, to mention, to load (luggage), to publish, to run (an ad)
乗っ取る(のっとる): to capture, to occupy, to usurp
乗り換え(のりかえ): transfer (trains buses etc.)
乗り込む(のりこむ): to board, to embark on, to get into (a car), to ship (passengers), to man (a ship), to help (someone) into, to march into, to enter
乗客(じょうきゃく): passenger
乗車(じょうしゃ): taking a train
乗換(のりかえ): transfer (trains, buses, etc.)
乗り換える(のりかえる): transfer
乗り物(のりもの): vehicle, vessel
乗る(のる): get on, get up on, ride in, be taken in, share in, join, feel like doing, be mentioned in, be in harmony with
jp_readingExamples: 乗せる (の.せる), 乗る (の.る)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You put a grain in your mouth and take it for a ride.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Just imagine you're a car or a train and the grain is a person. It's going for a nice ride in your mouth!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You decide the grain is probably lonely on this ride alone, so you add some nori (の) seaweed, so it has a friend.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now the nori is going for a ride too, woohoo!

Kanshudo_mnemonic: (looks like) an omikoshi with grain (禾) loaded on

乗字的基本解释

乗
chéng
古同“乘”。

乗
shèng
古同“乘”。

乗字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chéng］
［《廣韻》食陵切，平蒸，船。］
亦作“乗1”。亦作“椉1”。
(1)驾御。
(2)乘坐。
(3)登；升。
(4)著，穿。
(5)践踏。
(6)利用；凭借。
(7)掩袭；追逐。
(8)战胜。
(9)欺凌；侵犯。
(10)逾越；超过。
(11)指由水路行走。
(12)碾轧。
(13)防守；防御。
(14)奉行；施展。
(15)治理；管理。
(16)计算；筹划。
(17)方言。担当。
(18)运算方法之一。两数相倍叫乘，即今算术的乘法。
(19)佛教比喻能运载众生到达解脱彼岸的种种教法。如言小乘、大乘等。
(20)姓。汉有乘距。见《汉书》。
[②]［shèng］
［《廣韻》實證切，去證，船。］
亦作“乗2”。亦作“椉2”。
(1)车子。春秋时多指兵车，包括一车四马。
(2)用以指车兵。
(3)指马。
(4)数词。古时计物以四为乘。
(5)以二为乘。参见“乘2居”、“乘2禽”。
(6)量词

乗字的康熙字典解释

Basic explanation of words
Multiply
chéng
Gu Tong "multiplying".
Multiply
shèng
Gu Tong "multiplying".
Multiply
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chéng］
["Guangyun" Shiling cut, flat steamed, boat. ]
Also known as "multiply by 1." Also known as "Fu 1".
(1) Driving.
(2) Ride.
(3) Ascend; rise.
(4) Wear and wear.
(5) Trample.
(6) Use; rely on.
(7) Cover up; chase.
(8) Victory.
(9) Bullying; violation.
(10) Overstep; exceed.
(11) Refers to walking by water.
(12) Rolling.
(13) Defense; defense.
(14) Pursuing; performing.
(15) Governance; management.
(16) Calculation; planning.
(17) Dialects. Take charge.
(18) One of the calculation methods. The multiplication of two numbers is called multiplication, which is the multiplication of arithmetic today.
(19) Buddhism metaphors the various teachings that can carry sentient beings to the other side of liberation. Such as Hinayana, Mahayana and so on.
(20) Last name. Han has a multiplier distance. See "Hanshu".
[②]［shèng］
["Guangyun" empirically cut, verify, ship. ]
Also known as "multiply 2". Also known as "Fu 2".
(1) The car. In the Spring and Autumn Period, it often refers to military vehicles, including one carriage and four horses.
(2) Used to refer to chariots.
(3) Refers to horses.
(4) Numerals. Ancient timepieces are multiplied by four.
(5) Multiply by two. See "Take 2 houses", "Take 2 birds".
(6) Quantifier
Multiply

Radicals: 禾, 口  (grain, mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
You put a grain in your mouth and take it for a ride.
Just imagine you're a car or a train and the grain is a person. It's going for a nice ride in your mouth!
Reading Mnemonic
You decide the grain is probably lonely on this ride alone, so you add some nori (の) seaweed, so it has a friend.
Now the nori is going for a ride too, woohoo!
